description.raw:
Tested installing `ign-fuel-tools` from source in clean `ubuntu:bionic` Docker container.

Fixed some dependencies and updated raw file links.

# Configuration tutorial `02_configuration.md`

One error I did not fix:

```
# ./download -c /tmp/my_config.yaml -o caguero -n Beer -t model
[Err] [ClientConfig.cc:332] URL [https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org] already exists. Ignoring server
Error loading configuration file [/tmp/my_config.yaml]
```

I could fix it in one of two ways:

1\. Commenting out that URL in the example `/tmp/my_config.yaml`, but this is not ideal.

2\. I think the cause is that `ClientConfig.LoadConfig()` returns false when a server is already stored, which results in `download.cc` exiting [in this line](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/src/e3d955df2e116c1aa0253df25d8919d4f2e391f8/example/download.cc#lines-67).   
Changing the return value to true in LoadConfig\(\), i.e. removing [this line](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/src/e3d955df2e116c1aa0253df25d8919d4f2e391f8/src/ClientConfig.cc#lines-335), fixed the example. The red error still prints, but it proceeds to download the model.  
However, I don’t know if changing this return value would affect other things, so I didn’t change it in this PR.

# Command Line Tools tutorial `03_command_line.md`

This didn’t work when installed from source in empty Bionic Docker. `ign fuel` did not exist. It prints help message saying the available commands are `ign msg` and `ign help`.

I don’t know how to fix this. `/usr/local/lib/ruby/ignition/cmdfuel4.rb` exists from `make install`. I don’t know if something else is missing.
description.html:
Tested installing ign-fuel-tools from source in clean ubuntu:bionic Docker container.

Fixed some dependencies and updated raw file links.

Configuration tutorial 02_configuration.md

One error I did not fix:

# ./download -c /tmp/my_config.yaml -o caguero -n Beer -t model
[Err] [ClientConfig.cc:332] URL [https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org] already exists. Ignoring server
Error loading configuration file [/tmp/my_config.yaml]

I could fix it in one of two ways:

1. Commenting out that URL in the example /tmp/my_config.yaml, but this is not ideal.

2. I think the cause is that ClientConfig.LoadConfig() returns false when a server is already stored, which results in download.cc exiting in this line.
Changing the return value to true in LoadConfig(), i.e. removing this line, fixed the example. The red error still prints, but it proceeds to download the model.
However, I don’t know if changing this return value would affect other things, so I didn’t change it in this PR.

Command Line Tools tutorial 03_command_line.md

This didn’t work when installed from source in empty Bionic Docker. ign fuel did not exist. It prints help message saying the available commands are ign msg and ign help.

I don’t know how to fix this. /usr/local/lib/ruby/ignition/cmdfuel4.rb exists from make install. I don’t know if something else is missing.

title: Citadel tutorials update
